article.headline: Wyoming 86, UNLV 76, OT
article.story: LARAMIE, Wyo. (AP) -- Call them the Cardiac Cowboys. Brandon Ewing scored 30 points and Brad Jones added 24 as Wyoming came back from an 11-point second-half deficit to beat UNLV 86-76 in overtime Wednesday night. "We pretty much had trouble with their guards, off the dribble, driving the ball at us," UNLV coach Lon Kruger said. It was the second consecutive nail-biting victory for the Cowboys (11-5, 2-0 Mountain West); and while Wyoming pulled away in overtime, their previous four games were all decided by three or fewer points. Jones said the Cowboys have learned from last season, when they lost eight games by five points or less. "We lost a lot of close games last year that we should have won," he said. "I think that has helped us this year -- we never think we're out of a game." They looked like they were out of it midway through the second half, when UNLV (14-4, 1-2) began to pull away. With the score tied at 41, Wink Adams scored on a spinning layup, and Joe Drager hit a 3-pointer from the left wing to make it 46-41. Ewing hit a pair of free throws for Wyoming, but Wendell White hit two free throws of his own, and the Rebels got baskets from Curtis Terry and Joel Anthony and two more free throws from White to go up 54-43 with 9:07 left. But Wyoming fought back, pulling to 58-55 when Jones stole the ball from Terry in the backcourt and scored an easy layup, then to 59-57 on Ewing's pull-up jumper. Ewing hit a pair of free throws with 2:32 left to give Wyoming a short-lived 63-62 lead. White put UNLV back up 65-63 with a bank shot from the block and a free throw with 2:16 left. But Wyoming tied the game four more times, the last time when a layup by James Spencer tied the score at 71 with 25 seconds left. Adams missed on a drive to the basket, and Anthony's wild last-second toss fell short, sending the game to overtime. In the overtime, it was all Wyoming. Ewing scored the go-ahead basket, a pull-up jumper he banked in with 3:52 left in overtime to make it 75-73. Adams hit a free throw for UNLV, but Wyoming went on a 6-0 run, with Joseph Taylor's baseline hook shot making it 81-74 with 54 seconds left. UNLV couldn't come back from that deficit. As usual, it was Ewing and Jones leading the way. Ewing scored eight of his points in overtime, and Jones scored three and had an assist on Travis Nelson's dunk. "Those two little guards just kind of made up their minds they weren't going to lose this game," Wyoming coach Steve McClain said. Spencer, who hit the game-winning shot a week earlier in a 66-65 victory at San Diego State, added 17 points for the Cowboys. Ewing hit 19 of 22 free throws, including all six tries in overtime. Wyoming's run of close calls began Dec. 22 at the Rainbow Classic in Hawaii, when they went to overtime before beating San Francisco 84-81 in the first round. The next two games didn't go Wyoming's way -- a 79-78 loss to Nebraska in the final round of the Rainbow Classic, and a 75-73 loss at Wisconsin-Milwaukee. White finished with 30 points, 17 of them in the first half when he went 8-for-8 from the field. Anthony finished with 10. After falling behind 5-0, White scored eight points in an 11-0 UNLV run, and the Rebels led the rest of the half. UNLV went into halftime up 30-29. Kevin Kruger, UNLV's third-leading scorer coming in, bruised his left thigh early in the first half and didn't return.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
